channel.title: Dxing on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Dxing on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: When Signal Beats Noise
item.description: Today in Tedium: For decades, television owners haven’t been content with simply embracing the options already in front of them. There are lots of tales of this nature throughout TV historyâ€”from the people who owned (or in some cases, built) massive satellite dishes so they could pick up obscure television signals from other parts of the world, to the public-access weirdos who have long created their own kinds of television (some of whom got really lucky), to the people who got obsessed with the Amiga in the ‘90s.
